'Access Pharmaceuticals, Inc.' is a biopharmaceutical company based in Dallas,
Texas. [http://topics.nytimes.com/top/news/business/companies/access-
pharmaceuticals-inc/index.html Company profile at the New York Times, date March
20, 2009] It uses nanotechnology to modify existing medications to improve
their efficacy and tolerance.

As of June 2008, Access has one product approved by the Food and Drug
Administration (FDA), namely [[MuGard]] for the management of oral
mucositis. In September 2010, Access received its first U.S.
purchase order for [[MuGard]] and as of fall 2010 continued to receive more and
more prescriptions for the product. Also, two products are in clinical trials,
ProLindac, a drug that contains the DACH-platinum oxaliplatin (an anti-ovarian
cancer agent), [http://dx.doi.org/10.1039/C0DT00292E The status of platinum
anticancer drugs in the clinic and in clinical trials] Dalton Transactions,
2010, 39, 8113-8127 and a product with phenylbutyrate, a HDAC inhibitor.

In 2009 the company reported on preclinical studies of its agent Angiolix, a
monoclonal antibody that binds to lactadherin and inhibits
angiogenesis. [http://www.medicalnewstoday.com/articles/136722.php Angiolix
Results]
categories: Biotechnology companies of the United States
